text.0: they cleanse the goldhued like a red steed is he yoked and soma in the jar is mingled with the milk.
text.1: he sendeth out his voice and many loving friends of him the highly lauded hasten with their songs.
text.2: the many sages utter words in unison while into indras throat they pour the soma juice.
text.3: when with the ten that dwell together closely joined the men whose hands are skilful cleanse the lovely meath.
text.4: he goes upon his way unresting to the cows over the roaring sound which saryas daughter loves.
text.5: the falcon brought it to him for his own delight now with the twofold kindred sisters is his home.
text.6: washed by the men stonepressed dear on the holy grass faithful to seasons lord of cattle from of old.
text.7: most liberal completing sacrifice for men o indra pure bright soma indu flows for thee.
text.8: o indra urged by arms of men and poured in streams soma flows on for thee afterḥis godlike kind.
text.9: plans thou fulfillest gatherest thoughts for sacrifice in the bowls sits the goldhued like a roosting bird.
text.10: sages wellskilled in work intelligent drain out the stalk that roars the sage the everlasting one.
text.11: the milk the hymns unite them with him in the place of sacrifice his seat who is produced anew.
text.12: earths central point sustainer of the mighty heavens distilled into the streams into the waters wave.
text.13: as indras thunderbolt steer with farspreading wealth soma is flowing on to make the heart rejoice.
text.14: over the earthly region flow thou on thy way helping the praiser and the pourer thou most wise.
text.15: let us not lack rich treasure reaching to our home and may we clothe ourselves in manifold bright wealth.
text.16: hither o indu unto us a hundred gifts of steeds a thousand gifts of cattle and of gold.
text.17: measure thou forth yea splendid ample strengthening food do thou o pavamana heed this laud of ours.
